newsitem.title: PHILIPPINES: Jollibee begins scripless trading Jan 13.
newsitem.headline: Jollibee begins scripless trading Jan 13.

text.p: The Philippine Central Depository Inc (PCDI) said on Friday Jollibee Foods Corp will start scripless trading day on January 13.

PCDI vice president for operations Jerome Arcangel told reporters that all Philippine Stock Exchange member brokers holding Jollibee certificates are to turn them over to the depository from January 10 to 16 for conversion from paper certificates into computerised book entry accounts.
The PCDI will then issue confirmation receipts whenever investors trade in the share.

The following are the first few companies to go scripless and their conversion periods: Fil-Estate Land Inc (Jan 24-30); Ayala Land Inc (Jan 31-Feb 6); Mondragon International Philippines Inc (Jan 31-Feb 6); Metropolitan Bank & Trust Co (Feb 7-13); Centennial City Inc (Feb 7-13); Mabuhay Holdings Corp (Feb 14-20); Crown Equities Inc (Feb 14-20); Ayala Corp (Feb 21-27); and Waterfront Philippines Inc (Feb 21-27).
The Philippine Stock Exchange expects 75 percent of trading volume to be scripless by June 1997. Paperless trading is expected to speed up transactions and boost trading volumes.
